registerEventSink

public void registerEventSink(java.lang.Object sink)
                       throws de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.annotations.InvalidAnnotationException
Registers an arbitrary object as a sink for the delivery of simulation Events. After completion, the kernel starts to notify this object if an event occurs that matches the object's delivery requirements. More specifically, the given object is registered as an event sink in the Kernel, if
  • its type is tagged with an EventSink annotation and
  • at least one method is tagged with an AcceptedEventType annotation.
The method checks whether the constraints specified for both annotations are correctly fulfilled; otherwise an InvalidAnnotationException is thrown. Objects that have been already registered are silently ignored. Objects that are missing either annotation are rejected.

Parameters:
sink - The object to be registered as a sink for Event delivery by the kernel.
Throws:
de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.annotations.InvalidAnnotationException - if the specified object has no EventSink annotation or lacks a valid AcceptedEventType annotation.
See Also:
EventSink, AcceptedEventType, MomentOfNotification

unregisterEventSink

public void unregisterEventSink(java.lang.Object sink)
                         throws de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.annotations.InvalidAnnotationException
Unregisters an arbitrary object as a sink for the delivery of simulation Events. After completion, the kernel stops to notify this object if an event occurs that matches the object's delivery requirements. More specifically, the given object is unregistered as an event sink in the Kernel, if
  • its type is tagged with an EventSink annotation and
  • at least one method is tagged with an AcceptedEventType annotation.
The method checks whether the constraints specified for both annotations are correctly fulfilled; otherwise an InvalidAnnotationException is thrown. Objects that have been already unregistered are silently ignored. Objects that are missing either annotation are rejected.

Parameters:
sink - The object to be unregistered as a sink for Event delivery by the kernel.
Throws:
de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.annotations.InvalidAnnotationException - if the specified object has no EventSink annotation or lacks a valid AcceptedEventType annotation.
See Also:
EventSink, AcceptedEventType, MomentOfNotification

registerEventIncidenceListener

public void registerEventIncidenceListener(de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.listeners.EventIncidenceListener listener)
Registers the given parameter as a listener for the occurrence of future events. After completion of the method, the kernel starts to notify the given EventIncidenceListener object on every event that is processed throughout the simulation.

Parameters:
listener - The object to be registered as a listener for occurring events.

unregisterEventIncidenceListener

public void unregisterEventIncidenceListener(de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.listeners.EventIncidenceListener listener)
Unregisters the given parameter as a listener for the occurrence of future events. After completion of the method, the kernel stops to notify the given EventIncidenceListener object on every event that is processed throughout the simulation.

Parameters:
listener - The object to be unregistered as a listener for occurring events.

wakeup

public de.irf.it.rmg.core.util.time.Instant wakeup(de.irf.it.rmg.core.util.time.Instant timestamp)
Wakes up the kernel and commences the handling of events pending with respect to the passed timestamp. During the course of the method call, none, one, or more events might be processed and thus modify the simulation system state. In addition, events may be added or removed to/from the event queue. After the handling of all events pending for the given timestamp, the next relevant timestamp, i.e. the timestamp of the next event in the queue, is determined and returned.

Parameters:
timestamp - The timestamp for which events in the queue are to be processed.
Returns:
Instant The next relevant timestamp for the simulation kernel or null, iif currently no event is pending.

dispatch

public void dispatch(de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.Event e)
Dispatches a new event to the kernel for future handling. The kernel finds the correct position in the event queue and injects the event there. The actual ordering is determined according to Event.compareTo(Event).

Parameters:
e - The event to be dispatched to the kernel for future handling.

public de.irf.it.rmg.core.util.collections.SortedQueue<de.irf.it.rmg.sim.kuiga.Event> getEventQueue()
